text:
<@U02SR6E8Z9S> <@U0122RHUD2A> I have some questions regarded to contracts in Canton. Based on your support in Mr. Hoang Anh's case, I have successfully created a contract via `/v2/commands/submit-and-wait` and got the response:
```{
    "updateId": "122008f92d516dccff00f907d6eb9e023dea81f121cabfacb225d1ebc357838dadd9",
    "completionOffset": 15662
}```
I wonder what the `updateId` is? I guess it is not the contract ID? And what can I do with that `updateId`?
Next, I used the below API to get the admin access token:
```curl --location '<http://localhost:8082/realms/AppUser/protocol/openid-connect/token>' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--data-urlencode 'client_id=app-user-validator' \
--data-urlencode 'client_secret=6m12QyyGl81d9nABWQXMycZdXho6ejEX' \
--data-urlencode 'grant_type=client_credentials' \
--data-urlencode 'scope=openid'```
Then I used the admin access token to call `/v2/state/active-contracts`. However, I got the response:
```{
    "code": "NA",
    "cause": "A security-sensitive error has been received",
    "correlationId": "3f2d486a14d3564c239e51503b249cbf",
    "traceId": "3f2d486a14d3564c239e51503b249cbf",
    "context": {},
    "resources": [],
    "errorCategory": -1,
    "grpcCodeValue": 7,
    "retryInfo": null,
    "definiteAnswer": null
}```
So, could you please explain me which role/scope is missing in the admin access token? I need the contract ID for further interactions
Thank you very much!
cc. <@U0724J67GSE> <@U098ZSW8LPN>

text:
<http://localhost:9090/#/default/postV2CommandsSubmit-and-wait> check swagger for info about `updateId`
Check canton logs search for `3f2d486a14d3564c239e51503b249cbf`  to get more information about `A security-sensitive error has been received`
<https://daholdings.slack.com/archives/C08FQRCRFUN/p1754355790814939?thread_ts=1753956107.329089&cid=C08FQRCRFUN>

elements.text: A security-sensitive error has been received
get in the habit of checking canton log whenever you see error like this:

Request failed with HTTP status code 403
Response body: {"code":"NA","cause":"A security-sensitive error has been received","correlationId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","traceId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","context":{},"resources":[],"errorCategory":-1,"grpcCodeValue":7,"retryInfo":null,"definiteAnswer":null}
search by correlationId and very likely you will find more detail around the line you found explaining why you see the error

root.text:
Is there a built-in way to bundle more than one transfers into the same transaction using the external signing api ? Or our choice is writing our own DAML model to perform those ? Our use case is we want to charge a fee

Alice -> Bob
But also Alice -> App Provider (a fee).

We can submit separate transaction but prefer if they can be bundled into the same atomic tx instead

We can submit separate transaction but prefer if they can be bundled into the same atomic tx instead

text: <@U08987JD1J9> and others that are interested in getting a leg up on the Daml code for creating featured app activity markers as part of calling token standard choices from off-ledger parts of their app. Here's a sketch <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/issues/1901#issuecomment-3183999764> that might help.

attachments.fallback: Comment on #1901 PoC of wrapper Daml library for combined token std choices + featured app rewards
attachments.text:
A PoC of proxy wrapper is now available here:

• <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/pull/1907/files#diff-4cbc6e851f73f40db384d63aa97dbf4ffb93c505b0ed0c3c360e7914f94f6201|https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/pull/1907/files#diff-4cbc6e851f73f40db384d63aa97dbf4ffb93c505b0ed0c3c360e7914f94f6201>
• see the diff of the test changes for how to use it: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/pull/1907/files#diff-86d6136a6d3a8b1a45ea66d292327836b2ae17e857bc8f1d0b0762ac04665e1a|https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/pull/1907/files#diff-86d6136a6d3a8b1a45ea66d292327836b2ae17e857bc8f1d0b0762ac04665e1a>

Making this a default feature of a validator node would require:

1. packaging this up as a library like `splice-token-standard-featuring-proxy`
2. changing the validator app to upload the current version(s) of that by default
3. create a CIP that justifies point 2

I won't do more about making this a default feature of a validator node right now, as I can't justify the time investment. I'd be supportive of it though.
attachments.title: Comment on #1901 PoC of wrapper Daml library for combined token std choices + featured app rewards
